TopicTitle: Cannot leave flight, quiting the game doesn't help, nullrefs occur

Articles.Content:
KSP 1.0.0

Sandbox mode

 What happens: I edited my Ariane 5 and Atlas 5 a bit, but when I launch them, I cannot leave flight, and even after restarting the game (unlike similar bug), it fails to be fixed, unlike other bugs somewhat like this. I can click anywhere in the space center. I've noticed a few null references, but it seems each craft I edit becomes corrupted with this, making my saves unusable. It's multi-save affecting as well, same craft causes same issues. The Mac I use in KSP is low on storage, and my persistence files have been wiped a lot recently as well, though I've replaced them with quick save ones, and it seems to be fine. I can esc, I can't revert, go to space center or recover. I switched to a craft that seemed to be stuck in space, claiming it was landed, but obviously in space, similar to what happens in the fairings cause map view to break (documented in Enterelysium's career as well). This bug with the rockets started to happen after that incident.

I'll try to get the ksp.log when I get back to ksp. Maybe the crafts as well.

Mods

I've got 2 over dated mods, KER and contract configuratior 1.0.2, Kerbaltek/Historic missions 1.0.0. These mods though seem to not be the cause of the bugs.

I also have EVE, boulder Co, and Module manager and KAC

MacBookPro, 2012, Yosemite.

As another update, I found this only affects crafts with descriptions it seems. Huh, I deleted the description, bug stays, I think it always needs to be fresh?
